page.title: 03LANDSCAPE-DARENTH CHANGES
page.content: We can see the river through the fence at the bottom of our school field. Our school ground used to be a meadow . The Eynsford village used to hold an annual Donkey Derby. They had boat rides on the river . Now it would be impossible. We still catch fish but not so many. We have seen crayfish , trout, dace and chubb. Our caretaker said there were 33 varieties of fish. Now the river does not get cleared of weed and rubbish and it is getting silted up in places. In 1976 parts of the river dried up and many fish died. At the Millhouse in Farningham there is a weather vane which is a life size replica of a 9lb.2oz. trout found in the millpond in 1808.
